data.title: Supremely good Indian food
data.text: With great care they daily grind spices and make food fresh.  It shows in their food that they are serious and care about taste.  They are authentic but very tasty.  You can adjust spice or ask for it on the side.  Their tandoori oven is fabulous and makes Naan super tasty that will have you coming back for more.  The food here is better than the places I have been too in San Francisco London or New York.

data.title: 4.1 from 5
data.text: Very decent place with an excellent authentic indian food , i loved the white rice with the curry and dal soup. Sure i will recommend it to my friends , i can rate it as one of the best Indian restaurant in USA .

data.title: Hands Down, Best Place In Sandy
data.text: This is our go-to restaurant. We've been to every Indian restaurant in the valley, but this is top shelf. Say it with me - Chaaaaana Masaaaala. Coconut Kuuuurmaaa. I'm hungry already!

data.title: One of the BEST in the state!
data.text: Amazing food and service! We've been enjoying Royal India for 16 years! It's the first place I suggest to friends.

data.title: Great curry!
data.text: Great food!  Wait staff didn't hover and bother me every 5 minutes, which I liked. If you want constant check ups, maybe avoid the dinner rush.

data.title: This will become your new favorite place to eat!
data.text: Let me just start with the service. The wonderful owner and employees at Royal India honestly care about their customers and want you to have a great meal and a great experience at their restaurant. They are so helpful if you have questions about different dishes and their food is authentic and soooo good! As I'm writing this I'm craving Chicken Tikka Masala and Nan.  Rich sauces and tender cuts of meat will melt in your mouth. This is a family favorite!

data.title: Delicious Indian Food
data.text:
We found this restaurant in Sandy UT not too far from our hotel as we were passing through town for just one night.  We were very happy with our restaurant selection!

The staff is so friendly and attentive and the food was excellent.  We ordered lamb kebab, lamb biryanhi, and saag paneer and everything was delicious!  Highly recommended.

data.title: Authentic Indian cuisine
data.text: This very good Indian restautrant offers a nice menu. Food is very good and the service very attentive.  Vindalu lamb a favorite

data.title: The BEST Indian we've ever had- ANYWHERE!
data.text:
Royal India is consistently the best. Their food is amazing, authentic and reasonable.
The chef is consistent, he has been there for decades. The staff also has worked there for years, they are attentive, timely and very  friendly and welcoming.
The location is in an unassuming strip-mall, but don't let that fool you- it is the best Indian in the State. 
Friends of ours who are from India will tell you too- it is the most authentic around. But they also accommodate and will please people new to Indian food. 
We have had Indian food everywhere (LA to Chicago)  but always wish we were at  Royal! 
We visit Royal twice a week or more.

data.title: Wonderful and authentic!
data.text: Wonderful Indian food - the naan is the best I've had.  I love the Chicken Coconut Kurma and get that every time.  Their ice cream is to die for!

data.title: Long time favorite but.......
data.text: We have been going to this Indian restaurant for years now & it has always been excellent. The staff/owners are very friendly & love the atmosphere. However on our last few visits we have noticed that the chicken dishes a little tough. Don't know whether they have changed how they are cooking the chicken or if they are using a lower quality but it has just not been that fall apart in your mouth, heavenly Indian dish chicken. Hopefully this is not a trend & things will get back to excellent again.

data.title: Some Gems Among Our Choices
data.text: I visited with family (5 of us) and we got a fairly wide range of dishes. The lamb saag I got was the best lamb I've ever had in an Indian restaurant - it was moist and not over-cooked. The chicken tikka masala, on the other hand, had chicken that was a little over-done. A vegetable curry was wonderful, maybe the best dish overall. I am not often crazy about Indian food, but there were enough really good items among those we ordered that I would come back and try others.

data.title: Must-stop when we're in town
data.text: We're from Seattle and our kids always want at least one night at Royal India when visiting family in Sandy. Our youngest eats nothing but butter naan and rice but there is something for everyone here.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Love this place! Buttered chicken and coconut kurma are fantastic! Doesn't look like much, but the dishes are great. The waiters make some great suggestions if you want to try something new.

data.title: Excellent Meal
data.text: Wife and I stopped by the nondescript location and were quite pleased with the excellent service and equally excellent food.  The appetizer assortment was a delicious start to the evening.  I then ordered a meal, chicken madras, I had never had before and it was very good.  My wife always gets the vindaloo and she enjoyed it.  The only thing we didn't think was excellent was the rice, as we prefer basmati rice.  The service was tremendous as our water glasses never went dry and they continually stopped by to check on us.

data.title: Pretty good
data.text: We are fairly new to Indian cuisine. I have eaten here before. The food is good but the service is a little slow. We had lamb for dinner and it was very tasty. The portion was small for the price. The naan bread wasn't served with the typical dipping sauces. The restaurant itself could use some updates. Overall the experience was okay.

data.title: Great Service, Bland Curry
data.text: I went solo, and enjoyed great service.  The Naan was made as expected, as was the Lentil crisps.  I ordered the Chicken Madras, Medium spice.  It came out with no spice,and very little flavor.  To me this is "average" Indian food, as I have had much better.  The food was plentiful, and a single dish, with sides, could easily feed two people.

data.title: Hit the spot...
data.text: I am a curry fanatic. I enjoyed the chicken tikka masala, very flavorful. Naan bread was delicious. Chicken coconut korma was a little to coconutty for my liking but it was still yummy. Rice was not my fave but edible. Overall it hit my craving for Indian... Staff was very pleasant & they all called me by name which was very friendly. My son are every drop so he clearly approved.

data.title: Live in Sandy, try this place.
data.text:
this is a nice neighborhood restaurant that has great food.  Never been to India so I don't know how authentic it is but, what I do know is that what I have eaten has been delicious.  The portions have become slightly smaller over the years but, it is still filling enough.  I am a Lamb Korma fan, my wife and my son like Shrimp Saag.  The naan is crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.  I've tried the tandoori chicken, not my favorite because it is a bit dry.  I think that is the tendency of the meal because anywhere else I have eaten it, it is also a bit dry.
So, I stay with the meals that have a sauce, that way my protein is still tender.

data.title: One of our families favorite restaurants!
data.text: This has been our "go to" Indian food restaurant for many years.  We always do it as a family and are never disappointed.  The kids love the Chicken Tiki Masala and Naan.  I have worked in the service industry for many years and have never had anything to be critical of (which really is a big deal for me).
